descript.abstract: This layer contains data for the sewer interceptor system in the Twin Cities metropolitan area. Owned, operated and maintained by the Metropolitan Council Environmental Services division, the interceptor system provides the link from community sewer systems to the wastewater treatment facilities in the seven county metropolitan area.
descript.purpose: To provide a digital inventory of Metropolitan Council, Environmental Services division owned pipelines for maintenance, planning and analysis.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.

timeperd.current: dataset is up-to-date as of specified date.

theme.themekey: sewer, sewers, waste water, sewage, sewerage, sewer interceptors, sewer systems, utilities

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

browse.browsed: Sample map showing the interceptors layer.

citeinfo.title: Abandoned Interceptors, Sewer Interceptor Lift Stations, Sewer Interceptor Meter Stations

dataqual.complete: Entire seven county geographic area is covered.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy. The positional accuracy of the dataset is estimated to be 20 ft.

procstep.procdesc:
This dataset was derived from as-built plan drawings. The data were transferred to ETAK street base files and later converted to match a 1992 (?) Minnesota Department of Transportation street base. GPS and survey coordinate data has since improved its positional accuracy.
The Metropolitan Council is in the process of developing parallel data using GPS locations for more accurate positioning.

overview.eaover:
LINE ATTRIBUTES
Enabled: Network Utility value. False(0), True(1)
ID-NO: Name of interceptor
PIPE-SHAPE: Pipe shape (circular, horseshoe, etc.)
PIPE-TYPE: Pipe material
X-INCH: Pipe dimension value (x-axis inches)
Y-INCH: Pipe dimension value (y-axis inches)
LENGTH_FT: Point-to-point downstream length (feet)
SYMBOL: 1 = gravity, 2 = force main, 3 = siphon, 4 = outfall, 5 = low-head, 6 = non-MCES pipe connecting remote MCES point to network, 8 = bypass
SURF-TYPE: Surface type (bituminous, gravel, ground, etc.)
YR-BUILT: Year constructed
PROJECT: Construction project nomenclature
ALTER-ID: Alternate name
LS-NO: Associated Lift Station Number (Forcemain Only)
NOTES: Notes
INTERCEPT: Numeric ID for interceptor
SECTION: Hydraulic section ID (obsolete)
SECT_ID: Point-to-point pipe section number based on downstream orientation
INT-SECT: Unique relate field based on INTERCEPT and SECT_ID
DIMEN: Pipe section dimension (text)
WWTP: Treatment plant to which interceptor flows
BASIN: MCES defined treatment plant shed
METER: Flow meter to which the pipe is tributary
FROMPNT: UNIQUE_ID of feature at upstream end of section
TOPNT: UNIQUR_ID of feature at downstream end of section
YR_REHAB: Year last rehabilitated
METERS: Same as METER, but only populated where multiple meters are located in the same structure
TYPE: Text version of the SYMBOL attribute above
PARENT_ID: WAM relational attribute
ASSET_ID: WAM relational attribute

You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. You should consult the data documentation for this particular GIS Data to determine the limitations of the GIS Data and the precision with which the GIS Data may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.
